components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
As a cloud administrator I would like to be able to configure multiple router peers for my vpc cloud so that my networking does not have this single point of failure.

This story covers changes to eucanetd to parse changes to network json configuration (EUCA-12848), and configure MidoNet router with BGP peer(s) or with static router peer(s).
fields.summary: VPCMIDO: support multiple router peers in eucanetd

comments.body:
* VPCMIDO gateway information as in EUCA-12848 is now accepted by eucanetd.
* BGP information in network.json/global_network_info.xml is now actuated by eucanetd - i.e., there is no need for manual BGP configuration in MN (if BGP information is provided in network.json)
** eucanetd handles BGP for both MEM v1.9 and MEM v5.2
** changes in Quick Launch process is needed to test this feature when deploying Eucalyptus
** pre-Euca 4.4 network.json/manual BGP configuration still works
** VPCMIDO gateway and/or BGP configuration changes can be communicated via network.json uploads. eucanetd restart should not be required.

Due to changes in GNI parsing, regression tests for both EDGE and VPCMIDO modes are required.
Confirmed that eucanetd actuates 2 VPCMIDO gateways. Further multiple gateway tests are required (some changes in the QA system might be needed)
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
